column5: Great day on the water Cliff as always. Congrats again on the PB. It was a reoccurring theme this weekend as Headhunter got what he believes would be his PB pike on Sunday. Nice to know my guiding/boat control is in tune for my guests, I just need to figure out how to put more/bigger/any fish in the boat myself.
Congrats on the PB!!
Cha Cha Cliffster!!!  Beauty looking fish there dood!  Congratilyatilies!
Congrats on the PB!

Uh oh. Just read your post and while reading remembered I was supposed to let you know if I was coming. God I'm an   .  Public apology here Cliff, sorry I didn't get back to you and let you know. (being busy doesn't count as an excuse)  On the plus side wtg on the new pb! Beautiful clean fish.
Mike...no need for an apology!!  Seriously...it's fine!

Fishnsled and I had planned a while ago to reserve this day to go hunt down some fall muskies.  I have not been able to break the 40" mark when it came to any fish...and I was hoping to break that today.  It was a cold morning...with a skim of ice at the boat launch.  Good thing there wasn't any wind!  We launched just after 8am and headed towards our first spot.  As we neared it, we noticed a hunter hunkered down right where we wanted to fish...so we decided that they guy with a gun wins...LOL.  Off we went to spot number two...the wind freezing our faces off!  We began working an area and just we got near the end, I cast out my suick and begin working it back to the boat.  I was pausing the retrieve after long sweeps, and as soon as I began to bring it forward again I feel a hit!  A fish took a swipe at it and missed, so I let the bait stay there for a few seconds and began my retrieve again.  The fish smacked it hard and I set the hook!  It went crazy for about 5 seconds before I was able to get it under control.  I brought it to the side of the boat and knew I had a chance at breaking my previous PB Muskie of 39.5".  This fish will get MUCH bigger...it had a HUGE head and was just beginning to bulk up.  Quick measure put it at 41.5"...a new PB!  I know it's not a trophy fish...but it feels good break that 40" barrier...now need to get a 50! LOL   A little while later, as Fishnsled says "we're entering a hot spot right here".  Almost immediately he says "look...here's a follow!"  A few minutes later he sets the hook and a little muskie shoots out of the water!  It wasn't a big one, but it sure was exciting!   The bite turned off after that...but the temperature warmed up some and we had a great day on the water...lots of laughs and good times.  Off to fish for Walleye tomorrow on Sturgeon Lake with Big Cliff...that promises to be a great time...fish or no fish!
Musky !!!! Love those toothy buggers.I hope to do more hunting for them before ice in, and next year too. Congrats on your PB
nice looking fish! Can't believe there was a skim of ice already. I'm hoping to get out once or twice more myself
Congrats on the PB!
He didnt win Cliff,it,s called "RESPECT"  Nice on yer PB.
Nice musky ! One forty and now your asking for a fifty. Baby steps there buddy.... baby steps. Great report.
awesome, congrats for getting a new pb.  nice looking fish
Congrats on the PB Cliff!  That little one is beautiful!
Lol....I know....that's what Will said when I joked about that  Thanks everyone...was just excited I actually caught a nice fish!
A PB is a PB  Great job...
nice going guys  I washed lures all day yesterday looking for muskie...0/0

Great goin'. I saw you guys at the country style this morning while it was still dark. I had a great day too. Giant smallies, largies, a few small muskies, pike, and a tiger, it was crazy! Great job on the PB! Sorry I didn't say hi, I realized it was you when I walked out.
Way to go Cliff. A pb is always a great day.
Sounds like a fun day boys !!  Keep pluggin away Cliff and that 50"er will be yours one day  I'm heading out on Tuesday, maybe to Pigeon.

nice going on the PB cliff just keep chucking them baits and a 50 will find them.  Just out of curiosity what time were the fish turned on at?  When we were out they turned on fast at 12:30  we had 2 and another bat in the same are also had 2 by 1pm they were done as we stuck it out until 1:30 with out a sniff I sent a couple buddies over there and they got 2 just before and after moon rise.
Good stuff Cliff and Will, two nice muskies there
congrats on the PB.
Right on CCMT---now tell me  When it's over 40 inches----is it 5 pieces when you clean it?
I have been finding that the past month and a half. Most of our fish right at noon'ish
Nice job
Great report, fish and pics Cliff Congrats on your PB Thanks for sharing Leechman
Congrats on your PB. Time spent on the water will get you that 50 incher. I know, I just got mine 3 weeks ago.

Thanks again everyone!     The first fish came in just after 9am...but the follow and Fishnsled's fish came around 1130ish.  We didn't see another fish the rest of the day.  We got off the water about an hour after moonrise...hoping for at least one more.
nice fish and congrat's Cliff.
nice skis cliff congrats on your pb
